item.title: How would i
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

[quote=“Aurai, post:11, topic:179417”]I’m just suggesting that you learn what you’re talking about before you give people the wrong information, even with the right intention.
Sorry, I get worked up sometimes.[/quote]

gee i can tell -.-

To Warlock:
just make a boolean like this one

public boolean shopNPC() { if(npcIndex == <npcShopID>) { return true; } return false; }

item.title: How would i
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

since its a shop it wouldn’t have a default ‘attack’ option.

create a boolean that defines the npc ID’s that can’t be attacked then attach it to your npc magic boolean.

item.title: How would i
item.dc:creator: @Aurai Aurai
item.description:
@Aurai wrote:

Edit the statement

if(server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].followPlayer < 1 || server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].followPlayer ==

And make it so if the NPC being attacked on (defined by “server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].NPCID” or some other substitute for ‘NPCID’ in that statement) does NOT (!= operator) equal the ID of one of your shop NPCs, then the NPC can’t be attacked.

Read full topic

item.title: How would i
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:

int EnemyX = server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absX;
int EnemyY = server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - EnemyX) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - EnemyY) * -1;
int EnemyHP = server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].HP;
int hitDiff = 0;
int Npchitdiff = 0;
int wepdelay = 0;
CalculateMaxHit();
hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit);
faceNPC(attacknpc);
//viewTo(server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absX, server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absY);

if(server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].followPlayer < 1 || server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].followPlayer ==

playerId || inwildy2 == true) {[/code]
